result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.   Take all prescribed medications.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim or firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  Court finds the domestic abuse assessment is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Court set restitution at zero.

records.addlTxt:
THE COURT FINDS:
1. The inmate HAS NOT previously petitioned for sentence adjustment under 973.195, Wis. Stats., for this sentence.
2. The inmate HAS NOT previously petitioned for sentence adjustment within one year of filing this petition under 973.198, Wis. Stats., for this sentence.
3. The inmate IS NOT serving a sentence for a Class A or Class B felony.
4. The inmate HAS served the applicable percentage of his confinement in prison.
5. District attorney notification requirements have been met.
6. Victim notification requirements have been met.
THE COURT ORDERS
The petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it is not in the public interest.
Signed and filed. Copies distributed to the defendant and district attorney.
CHARACTER LETTERS FOR DEFENDANT.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, calendar successor, for review. mag

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Eleanora Madelyn W.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court ordered 12 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 12 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- DNA sample, pay the surcharge.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. Court finds the domestic abuse assessment is applicable.   Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Statements made by Susan J.  For reasons stated on the record, Court granted defense motion to adjourn so they can get statements.    Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for sentencing.  Defense counsel is in trial and will not have time to do the sentencing.  Statements made by Susan R.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:  Certified records filed with the Court and Court finds the Repeater enhancer is applicable.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/02/15 in Branch 40.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for status of counsel conference.  Attorney Valdez was given the wrong court and wrong time for this matter and did not appear.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Defendant served with the new date by the Deputy Gayle.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  Defendant would like new counsel.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Defendant informed the Court he would like new counsel.  After a discussion with the Court, defendant indicated he would like to think about whether he wants new counsel or not.  Case passed.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/10/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Status Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant is in custody and was not eformed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam Joshua Wampler-Volpendesta in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office.  The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 40.
